intro: Alsophila dimorphotricha, commonly known as the two-bristled tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of feathery, compound fronds. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its dimorphic trichomes, which are specialized hair-like structures on the fronds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Alsophila dimorphotricha plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing shelter and food for various organisms.
